title: Restricts the striking of enacting clause of bill without consent of sponsor
summary: Prohibits the legislative bill drafting commission from striking the enacting clause of a bill or resolution without express authorization of the primary sponsor.

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The legislative law is amended by adding a new section 26

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2604

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the legislative law, in relation to the authority of the
legislative bill drafting commission

SUMMARY:
This bill would add a new section 26 to the Legislative Law
to prohibit the Legislative Bill Drafting Commission from striking
the enacting clause of any legislative bill or resolution except upon
the express authorization of the Sponsor of the bill or resolution.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Legislative Bill Drafting Commission has, on
occasion, struck the enacting clauses of certain legislative bills
without notifying the sponsor of these measures. This bill would
prevent this situation by requiring the express authorization of the
sponsor prior to taking this action.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
None to the State.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
